FA25EEE9AE2E4D118727AA34079F53A8.description: Organize and create a presentation (oral, written, multimedia, etc.) of the research findings and conclusions.

407C3A5C047348CAA4A347EC0830B37F.description: Identify controversial issues and present multiple sides of the issue with supporting data.

78110C04180B48E7BE6D8316E90D7C8B.description: Interpret data, using statistical methods if applicable.

E193153B522E40D6B87B6CAAE01BA893.description: Assess the accuracy, reliability, and relevance of the collected primary or secondary data (quantitative/qualitative) by: identifying examples of bias and points of view, identifying and describing the data collection methods, determining whether or not the data is relevant and determining whether or not the data is consistent with information obtained from other sources on the same topic.

BCE7E21E9D3E40F4AA08ADD65471DB66.description: Collect primary or secondary data (quantitative or qualitative) related to the topic.

40885145DC96425EBAF70BAEABAA9323.description: Develop a rubric or other scoring schema to assess the research and presentation.

DB4D915B9EB54104B48871C5CF558346.description: Research and give a presentation of a current event or an area of interest that requires data collection and analysis

AA332E0A54A44BC1A1B9D05B6F6F8232.description: Solve, using technology, situational questions that involve data that is best represented by graphs of polynomial, exponential, logarithmic, or sinusoidal functions and explain the reasoning.

3E5C766BEFF646E19208C42946C5177A.description: Interpret graphs of polynomial, logarithmic, exponential, and sinusoidal functions to describe the situations that each function models and explain the reasoning.

F0D008369A7444ED81E6A7FDD4BC6577.description: Match equations of polynomial, logarithmic, exponential, and sinusoidal functions to their corresponding graphs.

88761B48E3D44C49B8C6C0D70DD68920.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for determining the characteristics of sinusoidal functions from their equations.

4636F1980CF94F76AAC483B012358266.description: Graph data and determine, with the use of technology, the sinusoidal function that best approximates the data.

470D145B95044C5C9B709BEAAD40759B.description: Analyze the graphs of sinusoidal functions and report on the characteristics of those graphs.

1FFF055617534DB4920AB35DC255FC45.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for determining the characteristics of exponential and logarithmic functions from their equations.

27CCF8C28A614D65BFC3DFE2AB520B55.description: Graph data and determine, with the use of technology, the exponential or logarithmic function that best approximates the data.

1057C6203623459A870A933E8CC16B12.description: Analyze the graphs of exponential and logarithmic functions and report on the characteristics of those graphs

73AEE03A80D749A98DF0B72E3388A9D4.description: Identify the degree and sign of the leading coefficient for a polynomial function that would best approximate a set of data.

A3870B74AAB84094A9329BFD60AFF857.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for determining the characteristics of polynomial functions from their equations

DC0D8F4CBE774A8D9A81142FDA708BA3.description: Graph data and determine, with the use of technology, the polynomial function that best approximates the data.

8D1737710E56401EA96E305DF6A93525.description: Analyze the graphs of polynomial functions and report on the characteristics of those graphs.

B7B2A2AE508647419BBE0B31AA8A45DD.description: Demonstrate understanding of the representation and analysis of data using: polynomial functions of degree ? 3, logarithmic functions, exponential functions and sinusoidal functions.

B2AFA6E084634064B452993F7D012BA0.description: Critique statements such as "If a question about determining the number of possible arrangements gives the names of the people involved, then it is a permutation question".

0B476E00BC1C46078258D09389505A0E.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for determining the number of combinations of n elements taken r at a time.

396CE062AD2D46568C68894ED28E9F42.description: Identify examples relevant to one's self, family, and community where the number of possible arrangements would be of interest to explain why the order within any particular arrangement does or does not matter.

286A5B3BC84D4F2F9F157527B1B4E1CA.description: Explain, using examples, why order is or is not important when counting arrangements.

A61A0EA27BE145C5B24202ECA31673D4.description: Solve situational questions involving probability and permutations.

EF042D3C39AB4DB6AD38CFAD707672AA.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for determining the number of permutations of n elements taken n at a time where some of the elements are not distinguishable.

A33420974CB54E79ADF43E8F99533B27.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for determining the number of permutations of n elements taken r at a time

A9B47C1DEECE4C148E301268128C1E12.description: Determine, with or without technology, the value of a factorial.

268BC95D5B614A27A6D46F615C98C861.description: Explain, using examples, how factorials are related to the determination of permutations and combinations.

ABA5AFF3FB1041BB9D810EE2CD93EC3E.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for determining the number of arrangements of n elements taken n at a time.

3EB5226FD9F4404EBD392D325416E80D.description: Create and solve situational questions involving the fundamental counting principle.

2410D3ABED7F4EC8919CD8E177E13915.description: Identify and justify assumptions made in solving a counting problem.

D893D5B7C4B549FC88DBE013E26A7B02.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply the fundamental counting principle.

C4C31B23FB984F2C938D46FA1A30DA0B.description: Represent and solve counting problems using a graphic organizer.

F1763073B15C45D48FC84597325B68E0.description: Demonstrate understanding of combinatorics including: the fundamental counting principle, permutations (excluding circular permutations) and combinations.

BADDEEC99DE3424D91AA1A9A57EE5AC5.description: Solve situational questions that involve determining the probability of dependent and independent events.

F93496B3037A46CE8865FC15AB442152.description: Determine the probability of two dependent or two independent events.

C8E5BA677FA94E80BBB0E00D6ED7F114.description: Determine the probability of an event, given the occurrence of a previous event.

1DADE89B779743AA94E81C559867FB9A.description: Provide examples of events relevant to one's self, family, and community that are dependent or independent and explain the reasoning.

55B4ECEE4706400DBB8B2D2845853FC7.description: Create and solve contextual problems that involve the probability of non-mutually exclusive events.

7A5CE5532F884382A1210694D224F5D9.description: Create and solve contextual problems that involve the probability of mutually exclusive events.

84CF256485F243ADA784ACD47595CC24.description: Represent, using set notation or graphic organizers, mutually exclusive (including complementary) and non-mutually exclusive events.

4F37E8BA3DBA4BA2A401A34C195B7F67.description: Analyze two events to determine if they are complementary.

0075D69FF76C4CADAC369D8BA75BE3B7.description: Provide examples of events relevant to one's self, family, and community that are mutually exclusive or non-mutually exclusive and explain the reasoning.

8C65BB27D9834C1F846B57363816B8C1.description: Extend understanding of the probability of two events, including events that are: mutually exclusive, non-mutually exclusive, dependent and independent.

CAC83B2D49F946E5AF02D5307218F4CE.description: Critique the statement, "If the odds are close, then the probability of the two outcomes also is close".

04A43A7D897349D8BC0CBB982EDCDF21.description: Identify, describe, and justify examples of correct and incorrect use of the words "odds" or "probability" in daily language or in the media.

533036B56ED545FF91437324CF67F5A5.description: Solve contextual problems that involve odds and probability.

57867F9772BA426484D4CE7C8EF8320A.description: Explain, using examples, how decisions may be based on probability or odds and on subjective judgments.

3E9E2DD8D7E04389A3EC606EAA4582F5.description: Determine the probability of, or the odds for and against, an outcome in a situation.

0DD40ACD5F8544BEA370683CA499E44F.description: Express odds as a probability and vice versa.

D665A25949644B2483ADD34497119A3A.description: Explain, using examples, the relationship between odds (part-part) and probability (part-whole).

8864121304504FC180F280078FA75746.description: Provide and explain the meaning of statements of probability and odds relevant to one's self, family, and community (e.g., statements of probability found in media, science, medicine, sports, sociology, and psychology).

669149E3FDAA4BF09D4653708124C3A9.description: Extend understanding of odds and probability.

14BC393B92944F2A9D1F1416D048ADF4.description: Solve situational questions that involve sets, including analysis of solutions for errors, using set notation where appropriate.

05A20FAE9D6B472F93CBA9D1F9B557E8.description: Identify situations in which set theory is used and explain the role of set theory in each situation. (e.g., specific Internet searches, database queries, data analysis, games, and puzzles)

5F62AB9CBCD54CDD9CA72D7E8431A21C.description: Develop, generalize, and apply strategies for determining the elements in the complement, the intersection, or the union of sets.

E5BE015DB3BB486694647DB4F63DB2CB.description: Name a specific region in a Venn diagram using the Boolean operators (or, and, not) or set notation, and explain in words what that region represents with respect to a specific situation.

97B2634067C444B3BC9F8F6929B0361F.description: Create graphic organizers such as Venn diagrams to display relationships within collected data or sets of numbers.

17553A7FB657468E909DD9A7AD11F081.description: Provide and describe examples, relevant to one's self, family, and community, of empty set, disjoint sets, subsets, and universal sets.

B2650E7FF5F14CCDB4B1E1A2A4578015.description: Demonstrate understanding of set theory and its applications.

16C9CD10E297415FAD22F7E25D887493.description: Solve situational questions, using a graphic organizer such as a truth table or Venn diagram, that involve logical arguments based upon biconditional, converse, inverse, or contrapositive statements.

A5B513D7203A4793AE38584C208A74A4.description: Identify and describe situations relevant to one's self, family, and community in which a biconditional (if and only if) statement can be made.

119C51EFFEA0436B83D10CD30DBB0C9D.description: Critique statements such as "If an 'if-then' statement is known to be true, then its converse, inverse, and contrapositive also will be true"

AAFAD623D8DE4AA799820F77F025864F.description: Write the converse, inverse, and contrapositive of an "if-then" statement, determine if each new statement is true, and if it is false, provide a counterexample.

0AF443C4410D48C9BB4B9A809A8D26E6.description: Make and justify decisions related to "what-if?" questions, in contexts such as probability, finance, sports, games, or puzzles, with or without technology.

22D93F93925C40BDBFE5BB0B7CCF827A.description: Analyze an "if-then" statement, make a conclusion, and explain the reasoning.

BCF0C4D32F54445EB9175651F12BBD8F.description: Create a variation on a puzzle or game and describe a strategy for solving the puzzle or winning the game.

6C77B16FC80E4593BCB6F473166372C3.description: Identify and correct errors in a solution to a puzzle or in a strategy to win a game.

1B28C7075222476783D08293427202F9.description: Develop, generalize, verify, explain, and apply strategies to solve a puzzle or win a game such as: guess and check, look for a pattern, make a systematic list â€¢ draw or model, eliminate possibilities, simplify the original problem and work backwards to develop alternative approaches.

83AA88E8BB0E4339AC5B0694EDBF93AE.description: Demonstrate understanding of inductive and deductive reasoning including: analysis of conditional statements, analysis of puzzles and games involving numerical and logical reasoning, making and justifying decisions and solving problems.

0E3D8A73F70E4D299D6ED5191C2CFFC5.description: Investigate and compare small investments over a long term and larger investments over a shorter term.

0577D60E9FCA4C05A0DF960B194B36CF.description: Compare the advantages and disadvantages of long-term and short-term investment options.

30F44BCE68C442DCAC44EF032534BA26.description: Investigate and report possible investment strategies that could be used to achieve a financial goal.

CE87D41481F6447083CA42E7E62B7D2D.description: Apply the Rule of 72 to solve investment problems and explain the limitations of the rule.

A4E33F3AC87D47368473AE2794C8CACF.description: Graph and compare the total value of an investment with and without regular contributions.

5A713C00DDB8461098C78564197416FF.description: Determine, using technology, the total value of an investment when there are regular contributions to the principal.

8179E8D6C3D2461894169F1E0432CF98.description: Analyze the strengths and weaknesses of two or more investment portfolios, and make recommendations for selection based upon this analysis.

EA587D9BA35C4CF0BA2A1F14B944AAD0.description: Solve, using technology, situational questions that involve costand-benefit analysis.

19499348E8D04177AEC863929A8A71D2.description: Solve situational questions related to the costs of renting, leasing, and buying (including questions that require formula manipulation).

A0FDA6FEA8194FDD9455D4FDC1AA0862.description: Compare renting, leasing, and buying of large cost items and generate reasons for considering each choice.

D89B1711C4DB4B25B028084B236FC255.description: Identify and describe examples of assets that appreciate or depreciate relevant to one's self, family, and community.

D1B340337C5E48F0A980ADE36270729C.description: Analyze, using technology, different credit options that involve compound interest, including bank and store credit cards and special promotions, and provide justifications for the credit option.

B06956AD864745CEA4EF43B02BDC8011.description: Solve contextual problems that involve compound interest.

AEC742F0FF4E4488BB2D92D7D7B6EA38.description: Determine, using technology, the total cost of a loan under a variety of conditions (e.g., different amortization periods, interest rates, compounding periods, and terms).

8EF8A369544D4A7FB862E4D54A956FB0.description: Develop, generalize, explain, and apply strategies for determining the total interest to be paid on a loan given the principal, interest rate, and number of compounding periods for the loan.

CCB75F9950464B38A7AC22E6D978FB24.description: Graph and compare the total interest paid or earned over different compounding periods for the same annual interest rate, principal, and time.

B68BEE9BE9D840CA95F0373EAFABA560.description: Identify and describe situations that involve compound interest.

8C5C00CEF8C94F8E8B4912611F67C96B.description: Compare the advantages and disadvantages of simple interest and compound interest.

757EBC945A0A49F8B0F267D915995AAD.description: Demonstrate understanding of financial decision making including analysis of: renting, leasing, and buying, credit, compound interest and investment portfolios.
